result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Logan Scharp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court due during period of extended supervision. Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. 
Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. 
Submit to DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: 3:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin Logan Scharp in court, in custody of Ozaukee Co Jail.  Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court for Justin Logan Scharp. State gives recommendation. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin L Scharp appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court for Justin L Scharp.  Counsel advises still awaiting blood results.  State advises as to anticipated timeframe for the lab results.  Counsel requests date for plea and sentencing on non-OWI cases, and status for OWI awaiting results.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Submitted by the State.  Forwarded to B3 jdash with linked motion.

2:01 PM Cases called 22CF193, 22CF196. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin Logan Scharp appeared by video, in custody of OZSD  Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court for Justin Logan Scharp. Bail Motion heard. State opposes bail modification. Court reduces cash bail to $2500 with all conditions to remain in effect.

(REDUCED FROM $8,000.00) All Bail Conditions Remain in Effect: Absolute sobriety. No alcohol. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No contact with: BM, WMM, RLC, DAP, and JEM. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.
